intro: Anthomeles, commonly known as the false arrowroot, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It consists of several species native to tropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their large, arrow-shaped leaves and striking inflorescences that consist of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. Anthomeles species are often grown as ornamental plants due to their unique foliage and vibrant flowers. They thrive in moist, shady environments and are relatively easy to care for in the right conditions.
